sect1.title: Identification, username and password
sect1.para: Whenever you launch PMB a login screen is displayed asking for a username and password.
This username and password were given to you by your administrator. If you are the systems librarian who installed PMB, consult the chapter on Users in the PMB Administrator's Guide.
By default, if no user accounts have been created, connect with username admin and password admin.
At the top left are two tabs: Management and OPAC. If you click on OPAC, the OPAC will be displayed.
As soon as connected, the PMB user licence (CeCILL licence) is displayed.

sect1.title: Changing your password
sect1.para: The user preferences are accessible at any time from the link edit your account, to be found at the top right of the screen (note: the user identified here is the "librarian" with access privileges to the PMB management interface). For more information see .
You can edit your password from the user preferences, or ask your PMB administrator to change it for you. For more information on user administration options, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide.
